subject: Software Quality Assurance and Testing - Lecture 2

questions.question: What does the abbreviation STLC stand for? [cite: 19]
questions.correct_answer: Software Testing Life Cycle

questions.question: STLC involves which two primary activities? [cite: 17]
questions.correct_answer: Verification and Validation

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a phase of the STLC? [cite: 20-26]
questions.correct_answer: Code Development

questions.question: What is the definition of 'Entry Criteria' in STLC? [cite: 28]
options: Items that must be completed before testing can conclude
Prerequisite items that must be completed before testing can begin
The list of defects found during testing
The cost estimation for the project
questions.correct_answer: Prerequisite items that must be completed before testing can begin

questions.question: In an ideal world, when should you enter the next stage of STLC? [cite: 31]
options: When the developers say the code is ready
When the exit criteria for the previous stage is met
questions.correct_answer: When the exit criteria for the previous stage is met

questions.question: What is the main purpose of the Requirement Traceability Matrix (RTM)? [cite: 49]
options: To estimate the cost of the project
To validate that all requirements are checked via test cases
questions.correct_answer: To validate that all requirements are checked via test cases

questions.question: Which document is a deliverable of the Requirement Phase Testing? [cite: 43-45]
questions.correct_answer: Automation Feasibility Report

questions.question: Who typically determines the test plan strategy during the Test Planning phase? [cite: 152]
questions.correct_answer: The Senior QA Manager

questions.question: Which of the following is an activity of the Test Planning phase? [cite: 158, 160]
options: Resource planning and test effort estimation
questions.correct_answer: Resource planning and test effort estimation

questions.question: What is the main activity during the Test Case Development Phase? [cite: 166]
options: Creation and verification of test cases and scripts
Installing the software on the server
questions.correct_answer: Creation and verification of test cases and scripts

questions.question: What allows the Test Case Development Phase to proceed in parallel with Test Environment Setup? [cite: 178]
options: Test Environment Setup is a critical aspect done alongside development
Test cases do not require an environment
questions.correct_answer: Test Environment Setup is a critical aspect done alongside development

questions.question: What type of test is performed to check the readiness of the test environment? [cite: 180]
questions.correct_answer: Smoke Test

questions.question: Which activity is part of the Test Execution Phase? [cite: 196]
options: Mapping defects to test cases in RTM
questions.correct_answer: Mapping defects to test cases in RTM

questions.question: What is a deliverable of the Test Execution Phase? [cite: 203]
questions.correct_answer: Defect Reports

questions.question: What is the goal of the Test Cycle Closure phase? [cite: 207-208]
options: To start coding the next feature
To remove process bottlenecks for future test cycles
questions.correct_answer: To remove process bottlenecks for future test cycles

questions.question: Which layer is at the base of the Test Automation Pyramid? [cite: 284]
questions.correct_answer: Unit Tests

questions.question: According to the Pyramid Strategy, which tests should be the most numerous? [cite: 341, 401]
questions.correct_answer: Unit Tests

questions.question: What characterizes Unit Tests? [cite: 285-286]
options: They test the entire system flow
They test isolated units of code and are small in scope
questions.correct_answer: They test isolated units of code and are small in scope

questions.question: What is the focus of Integration Testing? [cite: 313]
options: Testing how different components of the system work together
questions.correct_answer: Testing how different components of the system work together

questions.question: Which tests are at the top of the Test Automation Pyramid? [cite: 337]
questions.correct_answer: UI and Exploratory Tests (End-to-End)

questions.question: Which type of test has the highest maintenance cost and slowest execution time? [cite: 390, 402, 403]
questions.correct_answer: End-to-End (E2E) Tests

questions.question: When should a test case be automated? [cite: 270, 275]
options: When it is performed only once
When the task is repetitive and time-consuming
questions.correct_answer: When the task is repetitive and time-consuming

questions.question: What is the 'Ice-Cream Cone Anti-Pattern'? [cite: 410, 414]
options: A strategy where Unit Tests are the majority
A strategy where most testing is done manually and the pyramid is inverted
A strategy focused solely on security testing
A strategy that ignores Integration testing
questions.correct_answer: A strategy where most testing is done manually and the pyramid is inverted

questions.question: In the Ice-Cream Cone pattern, what happens to the team? [cite: 416]
options: They are stretched thin with upper-level tests
They focus only on Unit Tests
questions.correct_answer: They are stretched thin with upper-level tests

questions.question: In the Agile Quadrant Strategy, what does Quadrant 1 (Q1) focus on? [cite: 435, 448]
options: Business-facing tests that critique the product
Technology-facing tests that support the team
Business-facing tests that support the team
Technology-facing tests that critique the product
questions.correct_answer: Technology-facing tests that support the team

questions.question: Which types of tests are included in Agile Quadrant 1 (Q1)? [cite: 449]
questions.correct_answer: Unit Tests and Component Tests

questions.question: What is the focus of Agile Quadrant 2 (Q2)? [cite: 436, 455]
options: Technology-facing tests that critique the product
Business-facing tests that support the team
Technology-facing tests that support the team
questions.correct_answer: Business-facing tests that support the team

questions.question: Which tools are commonly used in Agile Quadrant 2 (Q2)? [cite: 460]
questions.correct_answer: Cucumber and Selenium

questions.question: What does Agile Quadrant 3 (Q3) involve? [cite: 462, 463]
options: Evaluating the product via user experience and critical thinking
questions.correct_answer: Evaluating the product via user experience and critical thinking

questions.question: Which tests belong to Agile Quadrant 3 (Q3)? [cite: 462]
options: Exploratory Testing and User Acceptance Testing (UAT)
questions.correct_answer: Exploratory Testing and User Acceptance Testing (UAT)

questions.question: What is the focus of Agile Quadrant 4 (Q4)? [cite: 438, 466]
options: Business-facing tests that support the team
Technology-facing tests that critique the product
questions.correct_answer: Technology-facing tests that critique the product

questions.question: Which 'ility' tests are covered in Agile Quadrant 4 (Q4)? [cite: 468]
questions.correct_answer: Stability, Scalability, and Maintainability

questions.question: In the Honeycomb Strategy, what are the two main optimization goals? [cite: 474, 482]
options: Optimize for Coverage and Optimize for Value
questions.correct_answer: Optimize for Coverage and Optimize for Value

questions.question: Which testing type typically uses tools like jMeter and LoadRunner? [cite: 469]
questions.correct_answer: Q4 (Performance & Load Testing)

questions.question: What is the primary role of automation in testing? [cite: 282]
options: To increase the cost of the project
To enhance testing and help testers do their job
To make the code look better
questions.correct_answer: To enhance testing and help testers do their job
